name: Feminist Qualitative Research in Action
description: Students will design and conduct a qualitative research project in the community on an issue related to women and/or gender. The course will also include an overview of the various phases of carrying out research: planning the research project, choosing appropriate methods for data collection, analyzing the data and reporting the results. Students should expect to spend approximately 10 hours conducting their research in the community over the course of the semester.
prerequisites: WSTA01H3 and WSTA03H3 and WSTB05H3 and WSTB11H3 and 1.0 credit taken from the courses listed in requirement 6 of the Major in Women's and Gender Studies
